page.title: 11MY HOME - A CONVERTED CHAPEL
page.content: Our chapel, which was built in 1840, used to be a Wesleyan chapel. There is another converted chapel up the road which was also Methodist but of the Bible Christian branch.Because they did not agree with each other ,people used to call the two chapels "Spite and Envy". The chapel up the road was soon made into the Sunday School as there were not enough people for two churches.There had only been one wedding there and that was the Griffin wedding. There are{NOT people buried in the garden.The last service was in 1963. In 1967 it was sold for Â£180 to the council. We bought it for Â£4800 in 1973. We still have the old door and windows.
